alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 4:39PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...The Yukon and Porcupine River at Fort Yukon * WHEN...Until Noon AKDT Friday. * IMPACTS...The runway remains cutoff from the terminal due to water over the ramp and planes are unable to taxi to the terminal. High water is impacting the road by the Voc-Ed building and flooding portions of 4th, 6th, and 7th Ave. Several residences in low-lying areas have flooded. There is also water around the north end of the runway. The road east of the Tribal Hall has been breached to reduce water levels and allow water to flow back towards the Yukon River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM AKDT Wednesday, a large volume of water from snowmelt continues to move down the Yukon River. Water levels are falling on the Porcupine River but are steady or slowly rising on the Yukon River. Water levels on the Yukon River at Dawson City and Eagle continue to slowly rise, so the Yukon River at Fort Yukon will remain high into next week. Satellite imagery and local reports indicate water is lowering in portions of Fort Yukon, but water and flooding of low lying parts of the community will persist for the next several days. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon or Porcupine River at Fort Yukon stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
